38669900.review: Charming pixel-art fairy tale about a forest sprite who falls in love with the moon and resolves to find a way to be united with it.  The starkly beautiful yet enchanting imagery  -  dark blue starry forest inhabited by friendly little creatures aglow with moonlight  -  combined with the resonant, lonely soundtrack craft a spellbinding atmosphere.  The kiddish writing and frequent jokey fourth wall-breaking are at odds with the presentation, though, and the storyline should have played things straight instead of ultimately opting for a meta approach.  Still, enough "once upon a time" remains here to make a lovely little experience.

Bu oyunu özel yapan şey, "yaşıyor" olması. Hani 1990'larda modaydı, "deniz maymunu" denen küçük karidesler vardı, yumurtalarını paketleyip satarlardı, alıp akvaryuma atıp büyümesini seyrederdik. Ya da bir teraryum düşünün, bitkiler o kadar alıcı görünür ki gözünüze, yapay zannedersiniz ama canlı olduklarını öğrenirsiniz. İşte bu oyun bana öyle hissettirdi. Canlılığından mutluluk duyduğunuz sevimli bir şey düşünün, onun hissettirdiği şeyi hissettiriyor. 

Neşe ve huzur dolu. En büyük hayali Ay'a gitmek olan bir karakteri yönetiyorsunuz, Lumpo türünde bir canlı, ismi Kinubo. Kendisinin türünden varlıkların olduğu bir köye düşüyor yolu ve yardım arıyor. İlk başladığınızda kalbinizi kırıyorlar köyde ama ondan sonra iletişime geçmeyi başardığınızda herkes o kadar heyecanlı ve sevimli ki. Kötülüğe dair hiçbir şey bilmeyen, meraklı ve heyecanlı küçük bir çocuk gibi hissediyorsunuz oynarken. 

Oyundaki her şey çok tatlı. Anlatamıyorum ya. Böyle kedi severken sevdikçe hırslanırsınız ya. "Lan nasıl bu kadar güzelsin sen!?" falan diye. Öyle bir şey işte. Yapımcı kişi de çocuklarından fikir almış yaparken zaten :)

Bu oyunun parasına gidip jelibon alıp yeseniz yine bu kadar tatlı olmayacak, o derece diyorum. "Minnoş, hanimiş, aman da aman" oyunlarla ilgilenen her oyuncu 1 saatini vermeli şu güzelliğe.

30399955.review:
Video Version of this review: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=879509466

You play as a character named Kinubo. His biggest desire throughout the game is to go to the moon, and you have to find someone who’s willing to help you get there. But no one will talk to you, because apparently, the other Lumpos don’t like strangers. None of these guys are happy to see you… except for one, of course, because otherwise, there’d be no game.

Then starts a chain of events, all of which involve taking a character’s hat in order to talk to other characters. But all of them want you to do favors for them… because video game logic. The tasks themselves are relatively simple. There’s one in particular that I like. Lanuno wants you to get her wand back from her brother Wizupo. But to get it, you have to do a bunch of gravity-inverting puzzles. They’re not really hard, but I did end up getting bounced around a bunch of times.

This game is very calm and peaceful. There’s no violence, no enemies, no weapons, and no traps. The only way you can die is by falling out of the bottom of the screen. This game is also very pretty. I like the glow of the moon against the dark blue sky. It’s quite pleasant to look at. And the soundtrack is so relaxing.

I find the controls a little bit strange. Usually, if “X” is to interact with stuff, then “Z” would be the button to jump rather than the spacebar. But whatever.

There’s this one door in a cave that doesn’t take you anywhere. I know the sign next to it leaves a hint, but I can’t figure out how to make the door work, if it’s supposed to work at all.

There’s also this one guy who has a flaming hat that he claims makes people hate you. But that guy wasn’t kidding. Seriously, if you wear his hat, not a single one other character likes you one bit. Not even the king will talk to me.

The king is the last character you have to talk to, and he agrees to help you get to the moon. But you have to set sail for another island for someone else to help you. But this is where things get quite different than what you’d normally expect from a video game. But I don’t wanna spoil it. So I think now’s an appropriate time for me to end my review.

So far, I have no complaints about this game. You should totally check it out. It may only be an hour and a half long, but it’s got an interesting ending, and it’s also a good game to play if you simply just want to relax.

29462621.review:
[h1]Genre:[/h1]
Side-scrolling adventure platformer.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
+ Very cute soulful main character, charming environment, simple yet heartwarming storyline with a bedtime story childhood innocence about it.
+ Chill & joyfull modern-classical Japanese music, relaxing background sounds.
+ Controller supported as well as XBox One controller vibration feedback, clean responsive controls.
- Minimal item interaction, lacking an inventory or skill which would give the game a more engaging experience for the older player, completing via speed-run is recommended.
+/- Fetch-quest based challenges.
+ Has some really interesting use of simple gameplay mechanics further within storyline.
- Short playtime of only 30 mins.
+ Fun & easy achievements.

[h1]Difficulty:[/h1] 
+/- Forgiving gameplay, great for kids, requires more for adults, hardcore gamers won't find enough challenge.
+ A simplistic adventure that’s highly recommended for younger kids with the ability to read.

[h1]Replayablity:[/h1]
- 1/5 None.

[h1]Graphics & Artwork:[/h1]
+ Really well-done 16 bit game design in the spirit of SNES games done in rich full color, but with more snappy animation performance, reflecting today’s hardware.

[h1]Overall Rating:[/h1]
★★☆☆☆ (2/5 Stars) Decent Game.
+ If it was released during the SEGA Mastersystem era this would be a beloved little classic.
+ Delightful way to spend 30 mins doing a adventure that pulls on your heartstrings near-end.
+ Recommended price is worth $1.50 during a Steam sale.
+ Inspired by the indie developer’s children, this is his 1st game, who’s genuinely a really good person who completely deserves the gaming community’s consumer support, in hopes to see him make another game.

29360368.review:
アドベンチャーゲーム。
月へ行きたいとずっと願っていた主人公Kinuboが住民たちに協力してもらい、月へ行く方法を見つけようとする内容だ。
ファンタジックな素晴らしいドット絵とほのぼのストーリー、ゆるいアクションを楽しみながらのんびりプレイできるアドベンチャーとなっている。

まず、目を惹くのはドット絵だ。全体的に丁寧に書き込まれており、光の表現は優しさが感じられて良い。「月へ行く」というのが目的になっているので、洞窟のマップを除いて全てのマップで月が目立つ位置にあり印象的なのも良いと思う。BGMや虫の音などの環境音もマッチしており、癒しゲーム的な雰囲気としては十分なクオリティだ。
ストーリーはいかにもインディーゲームらしい展開が待っており、開発者の想像の世界が表現されている。日本語には対応していないが流れでなんとなく展開が分かり、難易度も低いので詰まることはないと思う。
ただし、実績は取り逃がすと再プレイしないといけないものが多いので注意すると良い。

ボリュームは価格相応、ストアページのスクリーンショットの印象そのままのゲームなので、このようなドット絵が好みでのんびりプレイできるゲームを探しているのならオススメだ。

29338264.review:
[h1][b]Moonlight[/b][/h1]

Dieser Platformer wurde nur von eine Person kreiert, und er nennt sich "MonkeyMaw".
Moonlight ist ein wundervolles 2D Indie Spiel.

In dem Spiel geht es um ,,Kinubo'' der Hilfe benötigt auf denn Mond zu kommen, den das ist sein Einziger großer Traum.
Jedoch weiß er nicht recht wie er dort hin kommen soll.
Und sucht sich Hilfe bei ein paar Dorfbewohner.
Doch die Dorfbewohner wollen meist eine Gegenleistung sehen, und so sammelt ihr Sachen oder Redet mit anderen Leuten.

In dem kleinen Spiel gibt es 3(bis 4) Regionen, die so klein sind das man sich nicht verlaufen kann und auch keine Platzangst bekommt, Und dies fand ich auch sehr angenehm.
Abgesehen davon sind alle Regionen sehr schön gestaltet, genauso wie die Charaktere mit deren Lustigen und Guten Dialogen.
Mit der Schönen Atmospähre ganz zu schweigen, und erst die beruhigenden Musik im Hintergrund kann man das Spiel in 2-3 Stunden durch Spielen.
Was für denn Preis von 2,99€ vollkommen ok ist, und es recht wenn man bedenkt das es Eine Person Entwickelt hat.

Achja für die Errungenschafts-Jäger unter uns es gibt in dem Spiel genau 12.
Und Sammelkarten können hier auch gesammelt werden.

Ich kann in erster Linie dennen das Empfehlen die 2D-Indie Spiele mögen.
Und dann noch die Offen für Neues sind und Zeit haben ,,Kinubo'' zu Helfen auf denn Mond zu kommen.

28852898.review:
In Moonlight you play a creature fascinated with the moon and with the idea of travelling to it. A stranger to town, he needs to do the other furry NPCs favors to find someone to help him achieve his objective. The first NPC gives you a quest that rewards you with the NPC's own hat upon completion. This hat grants you instant rapport with the next NPC, as clearly if you deserved a hat, you deserve to be trusted. Thus ensues a short (less than an hour) 2D platfomer. There aren't any enemies, just a string of NPC to appease in a linear fashion. It is relaxed, has beautiful art/environment and *really* good music, there are several tracks which is surprising considering the length of the game, and they are all good.

While I do recommend this as an easy inoffensive palate cleanser between games, it did leave me slightly unsatisfied. I couldn't shake the feeling that this is more of a prototype than a complete product. It felt like the developer created this setting, mood, good 2D platforming mechanics, and then cut the project short. It doesn't help that almost all the doors you run into in the game are locked, adding  to the feeling that there was something more there that was left incomplete. I would have liked if this had more content: more NPCs, a bigger town, more tasks, etc. Just to give the entire quest some weight.

P.S.: Found it cute that the developer dedicated this game to his two daughters, I hope that one day I am able to dedicate something beautiful like this to my children :)

26157786.review:
Moonlight... La historia se desarrolla en base a Kinubo, un lumpo que llega a una nueva villa en la cual a los habitantes no les gustan los extranjeros, sin embargo, esto no impedirá que nuestro carismatico amigo busque la manera de recibir ayuda de ellos con el fin de cumplir su deseo, llegar a la luna.

Este juego es increible, una historia muy hermosa que te genera muchos sentimientos por los temas que aborda, con un final inesperado que rompe barreras y sobre todo muy emotivo, el trabajo artistico del juego es espectacular se ve muy bello todo, los escenarios, personajes y todos los elementos del ambiente, un soundtrack muy relajante que queda perfecto con la atmosfera del juego, uno de los mejores soundtracks que he escuchado.
Si bien es cierto que la historia es corta me parece que esta bien, esta muy bien realizada y de eso te das cuenta cuando terminas el juego porque te deja con ese sentimiento de satisfacción de que todo terminó como debía ser. Es un juego muy completo y supera las espectativas, lo único que si creo que le faltaría serían traducciones a otros idiomas, si bien se puede entender la historia con un poco de ingles que sepas, lo mejor serian las traducciones ya que es un juego que puede gustar mucho a los niños.

La verdad es muy impresionante todo lo que este juego puede generar en el jugador, por lo menos en mi caso logro crear un lazo emocional, esa parte final me hizo sentir tristeza y alegria de un momento a otro y verdaderamente me hizo sentír participe de ese momento, tendrían que jugarlo para entender de que les hablo.

Por mi parte este juego esta más que recomendado incluso si no te gusta el genero, si lo tienen jueguenlo y si no comprenlo y jueguenlo, vale la pena, este es una de las tantas joyas que tiene steam y que no son muy conocidos.

25319868.review: Moonlight is a super cute platformer that's combat free. You play as Kinubo who wants to go to the moon. For me one thing that makes or breaks a platforming game is the controls and Moonlight has good, tight and responsive controls, not at all floaty or slippery. There are some humorous moments in the game that are actually funny, the characters are cute and the music relaxing. It's easy to get 100% achievements, I missed 2 of them, one of them once, the other twice and had to play through it again. It's actually a short game, probably about an hour and a half to two hours long. It's definitly worth the asking price.

24908874.review:
Moonlight ist ein kurzes, aber wunderschönes 2D-Abenteuer mit niedlichen Charakteren und einer tiefgreifenden Story. Man schlüpft als Spieler in die Rolle eines kleinen Wesens, dessen größter Traum es ist, einmal zum Mond fliegen zu können. Da er dies aber nicht allein schaffen kann, benötigt er Hilfe von den Bewohnern einer kleinen, an einen Wald erinnernden Lichtung. Aber da die Bewohner gegenüber Fremden ängstlich sind, muss man ihr Vetrauen gewinnen, um Hilfe zu erhalten. Das tut man, indem man einige kleine Aufgaben für sie erledigt, wie z.B. Nüsse sammeln.  Die ohnehin schon wunderschöne Atmosphäre wird durch den riesigen Mond im Hintergrund noch um Weiten verschönert. Außerdem wird man durch das ganze Abenteuer hinweg von entspannender Musik begleitet.

Fazit: Es ist ein sehr gelungenes Spiel, dass man sich durchaus mal genauer ansehen sollte! Leider sind 2.99 Euro etwas teuer in Hinsicht auf die Länge des Spiels. Sollte man aber einen Gutschein besitzen, empfehle ich ganz klar, es zu kaufen! :)

23101049.review:
[h1]Moonlight[/h1]
Ein Spiel, welches 2016 für den PC von der Person "MonkeyMaw" entwickelt wurde. 
Moonlight ist ein netter, kleiner, storybasierter Indie 2D Platformer.

Die sehr kurze jedoch wirklich liebevoll gestaltete [b]Geschichte[/b] handelt vom knuddeligen Wesen "Kinubo" welcher am liebsten Non-Stop den Mond anschauen und dabei jeden Moment geniessen möchte. Er hat nur einen grossen Traum: Zum Mond zu reisen! Jedoch benötigt er dafür die Hilfe anderer. 

Auf seinem kleinen Abenteuer begleitet man Kinubo durch eine toll gestaltete [b]Atmosphäre[/b]. Man befindet sich in einem kleinen Dorf, bestehend aus Häusern, grossen Bäumen und einer Höhle. Sämtliches Spielgeschehen findet in einer herrlichen Nacht statt. Die ganze Zeit ist der Mond sowie funkelnde Sterne im Hintergrund oder Schmetterlinge am Boden sowie viele andere schöne Details zu sehen. Man fühlt sich wirklich wie in einer wundervollen Sommernacht. Die Dialoge zwischen den Personen sind sehr humorvoll geschrieben und oft wird auch die 4. Wand durchbrochen. Lachen wird man also nicht zu wenig. :D

Die [b]Grafik[/b] ist im gelungenen Retro 16Bit Stil gehalten. 
Zusammen mit dem romantischen Ambiente der [b]Musik[/b], welche perfekt zum Spiel passt, erlebt man beim Spielen eine schöne, in sich stimmige Welt. 


Das [b]Gameplay[/b] ist sehr simpel aufgebaut. Der kleine Kinubo benötigt hilfe, um sein Traum vom Flug zum Mond zu verwirklichen. Die Bewohner des kleinen Dorfes sind jedoch sehr ängstlich und skeptisch  Fremden gegenüber. Kinobu erledigt für sie kleine aufgaben, gewinnt mehr und mehr das Vertrauen der Leute und bekommt als Belohnung ihre Hüte, als Zeichen der Dankbarkeit. 

Die 	[b]Steuerung[/b] ist ebenso einfach wie das Gameplay. Links, rechts, Springen und interagieren. Mehr kann Kinubo nicht. Die Ganze fühlt sich sehr solide an und das Springen ist präzise und nicht schwammig. 

[b]Einstellungsmöglichkeiten[/b] bietet das Spiel für den Umfang Genügend: Audiolautstärken, Auflösung als Multiplikator und flexible Steuerung. Kritikpunkt ist, dass die Sprache nur auf Englisch ist. Jedoch ist die Sprache selbst für Anfänger relativ einfach zu verstehen. 
[b]Der Schwierigkeitsgrad[/b] ist eigentlich nicht vorhanden. Es ist ein Spiel fürs Zurücklehnen und Geniessen.
Die [b]Spielzeit[/b] beläuft sich auf 1 bis 2 Stunden.

[b]Fazit[/b]
Moonlight ist ein schönes kleines 2D Story-Platformer Spiel zum geniessen und entspannen. Mit 1 bis 2 Stunden Spielzeit und einem Preis von momentanen 3 CHF (Euro) ist es jedoch relativ teuer. Hat man jedoch einen Gutschein oder ist es rabattiert, ist es definitiv ein Spiel, welches man sich mal kurz gönnen sollte. Ich gebe [b]eine Kaufempfehlung[/b]!

22500908.review:
[h1]Hallo. Ich bin Kinubo und mein größter Wunsch ist es, den Mond besuchen zu können. Kannst du mir dabei helfen?[/h1] 

Das Spiel mit dem Titel "Moonlight" (dt. Mondlicht oder Mondschein) ist anfang 2016 für den PC erschienen, und wurde von nur einen einzigen Mann, namens "MonkeyMaw", entwickelt und gepublished!
Vom Genre her wird es in die Kategorie des 2D-Indie-Platformer eingeordnet.
Der Protagonist im Spiel ist ein kleines, kuschelig aussehendes, männliches Geschöpf, namens "Kinubo".
Kinubo's größter Wunsch ist es, eines Tages den Mond besuchen zu können.
Doch leider weiß er nicht, wie man zum Mond gelangen kann.
Und somit macht er sich in einem fremden Dorf auf die Suche nach jemanden, der ihm bei seinem Vorhaben unterstützen könnte.
Im folgenden Verlauf möchte ich gerne näher auf meine Wahrnehmungen und Empfindungen eingehen.
Schon von der ersten Minute an, hat mich das Spiel in seinem Bahn gezogen!
Die Umgebung wirkt durch das Sehen, und das Hören vom Soundtrack, sehr friedvoll, beruhigend und niedlich!
Die Welt ist auch nicht allzu groß entwickelt worden, somit habe ich mich also niemals verlaufen, oder fühlte mich auch nicht erdrückt/erschlagen von einer zu großen Spielwelt.
Selbst die Sprung-, und Rätselherausforderungen waren alle sehr gut machbar, und nicht zu schwierig.
Des weiteren fühlt sich das Springen sehr dynamisch, und nicht schwammig an.
Und genau das ist es, was der Entwickler wahrscheinlich damit bewirken wollte.
Er verfolgt die Intention, dass das Storytelling im Vordergrund steht.
Der Spieler sollte entspannend und angenehm eine Geschichte miterleben.
Vor allem sind die Dialoge der Charakteren wirklich witzig gestalten worden.
Somit bleiben selbst die Neben-Charaktere einem im Gedächtnis.
Die Spieldauer beträgt ca. 2 bis 3 Stunden.
Hierbei empfehle ich auf jeden Fall, sich für dieses Spiel die 2 Stunden beiseite zu nehmen, und die Geschichte an einem Stück zu erleben.
Als ich dieses Spiel gespielt habe, hatte ich keine negativen Eindrücke empfinden können.

Zusammenfassend ist also zu sagen, dass "Moonlight" ein kurzes, aber recht feines und niedliches Platformer Spiel ist.
Alle im Spiel vorhandenen Charakteren sind mir, trotz der kurzen Spieldauer, bereits ans Herz gewachsen.
Ich bin froh darüber, dass ich auf dieses Spiel gestoßen bin, da ich einige moralische Werte für mich selbst mitnehmen konnte.
Deshalb empfehle ich dieses Spiel an jedem weiter, der gerne mehr Wert auf Story, als auf Herausforderungen, legt.
Für den niedrigen Geldbetrag, bekommt man wirklich ein kleines Meisterwerk! (o^.^o)

22463878.review:
An adorable story-centric and atmospheric platformer. Albeit short, very much worth your while.  

In this little metroidvania like platformer you, as the main character Kinubo, try to get to the moon. There are no battles, no brain-scratchingly hard puzzles to stop you. The platforming is on the easier side even for someone who does not really excel at such things. That's alright though, for as silly as the story seems to be, it does grip you quite unexpectedly. 

The design choices are excellent. The art is well thought out and executed for a cute, simple look. The music however, is the thing that makes this game come together. It's relaxing and sets a great mood for the game. Moonlight might just be one of the only games which soundtrack I loved through and through. 

An excellent game. Highly recommended, especially for winding down after a busy day. Would also work well as an interactive goodnight story for children (though there were some word choices you might feel the need to edit). 

Rarely have I been this impressed in this short of time.

22347113.review:
Early this week I was browsing the Steam Store for something new to pick up and try, upon further searching through the store I came across this game, Moonlight. Moonlight is a very short, yet rewarding game, or so it was to me. It's a story driven platformer with a few light puzzles implemented into it. Once I loaded the game in you are greeted by the calm atmospheric tones of this absolutely beautiful soundtrack that just fits the entire game perfectly. Which brings me to the art style of the game, the art style of the game for me on a personal level is just amazing. I'm a huge fan of 2D/Bit games like these, add a little platforming and I'm sold. But the art style in general is very calming, thought the entire game (except one area) you have the Moon looming over head, always in sight casting it's glow on the "land" you walk, the blue over tone fits it all to perfectly and just makes it a calming theme. During your adventure you meet several characters in the village, some you might like at first, others might have to grown on you, but none the less the very short few minutes to spend helping these characters leave a lasting effect in your heart. You really start to feel attached to them and really want to hang around them more, but you must move on in your adventure. I'd like to say as much as I can about the ending without spoiling anything, but to be honest I can't think of anything I could say that wouldn't spoiler it. You'll just have to play it yourself and find out. I paid $4.99 for this game, for what I played and the enjoyment I got from it, I'd pay $10 easy for this game. I strongly recommend picking up and trying Moonlight out for yourself, oh and explore as much as you can, there's little hidden things here and there. 
All in all, if I was a professional game reviewer I would give Moonlight a 10/10, to be honest I'm sitting here trying to think of some flaws this game has, sure there might be a few things that need fixing, but nothing game changing or anything that will change your experience.
Thanks!

21694437.review: Durante uno dei primi anni delle elementari la mia maestra di italiano ci sottopose un testo da leggere e commentare. Parlava di un coniglio antropomorfo che per chissà quale ragione non era ben visto dagli altri animali, e per questo non riusciva a farsi degli amici. Per ovviare a questo problema si metteva a coltivare gli ortaggi più vari, e una volta raccolto il frutto del suo duro lavoro, organizzava un banchetto per gli altri animali, con il risultato di ingraziarseli tutti e diventare ben accetto. Tralasciando il fatto che fui l'unico in classe a commentare (passando da persona problematica) che il coniglio aveva fatto male, perché l'amicizia era un valore che non si può comprare con cose così materiali come un paio di ortaggi, mi sembra chiaro che Moonlight - breve platform dalle pretese artistiche - si ispiri a un simile immaginario, scaturito da una mente infantile (fatto confermato nei titoli di coda) e soprattutto adatto a un pubblico infantile. Avete presente The old tree, un puzzle game ftp scaricabile qui su Steam? Entrambi i titoli parlano di un'entità non meglio definibile spinta da un irrefrenabile desiderio verso l'alto, immotivato, magico, magnetico; entrambi puntano sull'avere un'atmosfera unica e ben riconoscibile. E' in questo che Moonlight brilla: lo scenario notturno creato è così addolcito, quasi lisciato direi, da una colonna sonora rilassante e struggente, nonché da suoni ambientali fluidi e "umidi", che pare denso, palpabile, sicuro. Fa venire in mente nella sua limitatezza un parco giochi vissuto a pieni polmoni, con i sensi acuiti dall'infanzia, e questo va considerato un traguardo eccezionale, dato che riesce a mascherare benissimo una realtà in cui la contenutezza è solo un'imposizione degli scarsi mezzi. Tuttavia, se The old tree si fermava qui, Moonlight si spinge a creare una cornice, dei personaggi, addirittura un contenuto. Ed è questo che risulta profondamente deludente. Ci sono alcune esperienze sempreverdi in ambito videoludico, dei linguaggi universali capaci di essere colti e interpretati in maniera differente a qualsiasi età. Nintendo ha fatto di queste un impero. Moonlight invece NON riesce a dire niente al giocatore adulto: la caratterizzazione è infatti totalmente rivolta a un immaginario giovanissimo, con battute che sembrano uscite da un'improvvisata storia della buonanotte. Il modo in cui si sfonda la quarta parete è brusco e immotivato, non aggiunge profondità, sembra solo essere lì per far vedere che "si può fare" a un audience inesperto; il momento dell'addio non riesce a essere commovente, non al di là del tema di per sé che da sempre colpisce particolarmente il bambino: il cambiamento. Quando ormai mi ero convinto a fare la mia parte, e, presa carta e penna, ho iniziato a decifrare il messaggio finale del gioco immaginando con quale serena curiosità questo potesse essere fatto da un figlio insieme ai genitori, sono rimasto letteralmente di sasso: non so se ho interpretato bene, ma non mi sembra veramente una buona idea gettare un velo di angoscia verso la fine di un'esperienza simile. Contenuto a parte, il gameplay è abbastanza rifinito e vario, le meccaniche di salto funzionano anche qui "accennando" a temi ormai classici del genere (vedi le bolle di Squirreltopia, l'inversione di gravità di VVVVVV) e rimanendo a livello così epidermico che un'analisi approfondita, se possibile, sarebbe ridondante. In definitiva, Moonlight è un gioco che si vergogna troppo del suo target, decisamente preadolescenziale. Esattamente come Nihilumbra esclude nettamente dal suo universo di riferimento i non adolescenti, nei temi di Moonlight è molto difficile "entrare" se si è adulti. Tuttavia l'eccellente livello estetico di superficie, aiutato da un po' di sforzo mnemonico di emozioni e pensieri, rende palese a tutti la genuinità del prodotto, un vero e proprio pegno d'amore di un padre verso la sua prole.

[h1]One-Sentence Summary[/h1]
This sidescrolling non-combat adventure game is a beautifully made one hour vignette that is highly endearing, whimsical, and at moments quite touching.

[h1]Strengths:[/h1]
+ Beautiful atmosphere, artwork, soundtrack, writing
+ Concisely explored themes of friendship & camaraderie
+ A testament that games can be short and still feel complete
+ Fun and interesting meta narrative elements
+ Unique HATS that grant special powers and popularity!

[h1]Weaknesses:[/h1]
- Controls can feel slightly lagged/stiff at times
- the.kuribo ≠ the.kinubo

[h1]Final Thoughts:[/h1]
This is a wonderful game that comes together very well in a concise, yet fully realized and beautifully atmospheric world.  The writing is not verbose, yet it still manages to convey themes that many games with much higher budgets and longer playtimes struggle to do.  This is a game that I think would capture the imagination of both young and old, and I fully intend to have my young children play through this game as the writing is simple enough that they can understand it while also picking up some of the positive thematic messages on friendship, tenacity, and achieving one's dreams through the help of others.  My hats off to MonkeyMaw Games for creating this, I highly recommend Moonlight to all!

21069824.review:
'Moonlight' is a peaceful, delightful game about helping one another (and playing with stylish hats ^_^). The tone, artwork and music are all lovely. While short (I beat it in 2 hours), it was a lovely experience.

---- PROS ----
- Great Artwork
- Lovely UI, Menus (yes, I notice stuff like that)
- Good dialogue with the characters
- Characters that have a lot of charm and personality. I particularly liked the clear emotions of the characters at different parts of the story.
- Beautiful calm, atmospheric music
- Simple to understand gameplay (all you do is jump and talk to people...though it gets a *bit* more complicated than that) ~_^

---- CONS ----
- Short. While lovely, the game can be beaten in about two hours. Know that going in. :)
- There were a few grammatical errors in the dialogue (I believe the dev said they're working on that, so that's good)
- I didn't like how the game defaulted to using the directional pad for movement instead of the left analog stick.(I think both should work right away.) Regardless, in the settings I was able to change movement to left analog stick. I still had to use the 'X' button to talk to people instead of the 'A' button (which I prefer), but it wasn't a big deal. I got used to it pretty quickly.
- This is sort of a nitpick with the trailer, not with the game itself. At over 4 minutes long, I think it shows too much. I mean, 'Moonlight' is not a long game, so as much of it should be preserved for the player to experience. I would think a minute long trailer - maybe a minute and a half showing a variety of gameplay (and nothing past the hot air balloon) - would be cool. Just a thought. ^_^

---- TL; DR ----

'Moonlight' is a calm, atmospheric platformer with a great look, soothing music and interesting characters. While short, it does what it does very well and I look forward to further work from the developer. 

---- FINAL GRADE ----
8 out of 10

21060518.review:
I've never really got into steam truth be told, but after watching my girlfriend and her friends playing this game on the tv, I wanted to try it for myself. I created an account just for this game basically. Although I'll get more I'm sure. Now, I could have played her game, but I wanted to really play it through and give my opinion.

I'd like to start with the only con that I can come up with, content. I'm not saying that I didn't get my money worth either! This was definitely worth my money. No, I'm talking about wanting more content. I sincerely wish, that there was more of this world. I wish there were more locations, more characters, more hats, more of these puzzles, and please ... more of this art and atmosphere!

With the one con out of the way, I can sum up this game's art and atmosphere pretty well with, simply beautiful! I tend to like detailed pixel art, and that isn't the case here. It's rather clean if you will, but there is just something about it. The details are not in the art itself, but more of a combined entity? It's all so very smooth and I don't know, it just makes you really enjoy the enviroment. The trees, especially the big one, is just something else! You can barely tell in some screen shots, but the light on the edges of all the bark is just awesome! The character art is very cute and charming. I do believe a little variation would have been interesting, but it feels hard to complain about it too much.

The music is phenominal to say the least. There is a media player in the game's menu, or I guess it is called the jukebox. Apparently there are only six tracks, but none of it is repetitive as the tracks are fairly long. It has a unique kind of sound, it's kind of oriental sounding in a way. It might not be something you would listen too outside of this game, but with the game's feel, it works well.

The story is also not something to be ignored, especially since the game relies on it heavily. The story as a whole is not the game's strongest point though, and without some very key elements, it would be dismissable. The key elements, are the characters telling that story. Each individual character seems to have a very real personality. You cannot help but create voices in your head for these little guys. Obviously Buko for the win, but all the characters seem to matter in their own little ways. The only gripe is that Kinubo, the character you play, has what seems to be a changing personality. He's all over the place some times. However, once I saw the ending, I think I get it. He's the player, he is the culmination of many different types maybe?

I want to wrap this up, but there is one thing I have to finish with, and that is this developer. I emailed him with a few questions about the game, and how many people worked on it etc. With the production level in this game, the art, the lack of any real bugs, I assumed it was a few people at least! It was interesting to find out that he is the only one. His "type" is something we need to see more of as well. He is extremely polite, helpful, and he even gave me a few keys for friends! I really enjoyed the game and the interaction with Monkeymaw, I hope for more, I wish him the very best!

20976747.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s6Yv0M9S1UM
( [b]TL;DR[/b]: Really enjoyed it, well done for an indie game. Recommended. )

[u][b]No Spoiler Review[/b][/u]:

[b]Graphics & Ambience[/b]: I loved the style of the game, the graphics and the music were beautiful and it tied in perfectly with the story. Everything is cute and light-hearted. This is a very well-made indie game, it flows well -- even my old office desktop computer can handle it.

[b]Gameplay[/b]: There were mechanics that surprised me at some points, namely the way to jump high. Pressing X & C took some getting used to. There were no points where I got stuck or the game crashed. A+ for that.

[b]Story & Humor[/b]: Good, I like the way you interact with the other characters, it reminded me a little bit of Super Mario Sunshine, one of my favorite childhood games. In the end I think this game goes pretty deep into society but that's just my interpretation, I'd like to think that it does.

[b]Let's Playability[/b]: Super, there were no spaces for me where I couldn't put commentary, it was great to make the characters have different types of voices and personalities, hopefully in a way that you (dev) intended. Thank you for making this game, I had a fun time recording it for my channel.

[b][u]Recommended[/u][/b]? Yes. One of the better indie games that has come out. If you have a Youtube channel and you're looking for something to play for it, this game is a perfect choice especially if you do story-driven or cute games. Otherwise, if you're a (casual) gamer, you'll still enjoy the story and the gameplay a lot. Definitely worth a try (& buy).

[b]Cons[/b]: The game bugs out when you exit the program, making you force-close it. That's all.
